p: The antiplasmodial activity of CH 2Cl 2/CH 3OH (1:1) extract of the root bark of M. dura Dunn was investigated and the minimal activity was found for compounds viz. calopogonium isoflavone B, maximaisoflavone B and 7, 2′-dimethoxy-4′, 5′-methylenedioxyisoflavone against the chloroquine-sensitive 3D7 and the chloroquine-resistant Dd2 P. falciparum strain where the activity found in between 70 and 90% inhibition at 40 μM ( Marco et al., 2017).
